channel.title: Hydrascape is not welcome here
channel.description:
Quick warning about "Hydrascape" - [b]it is being run by known scammers[/b], probably with the intention of stealing any passwords they can get from you after they've whored everyone for their money through donations and adverts.
Talking about Hydrascape anywhere outside questions in this thread = ban. Advertising Hydrascape = ban.
[b]If you have run anything from them already, I strongly suggest taking measures to get rid of the ddosers/password stealers that are probably running on your pc.[/b]
Thanks and good day :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 18, 2008, 12:07:04 am[/size][hr]An amendment to the original post:
I have spoken with the owner of Hydrascape, and he is understandably pretty pissed that we've felt the need to do this. I realise that in my original post I was pretty aggresive, so I should probably point out that I have no proof that there is anything going on at Hydrascape other than a group of people trying to make a successful server, and it is possible that they are 100% legit. However, given the reputation of the staff, it's equally possible that its not.
So for now I'm going to say that the above post still applies, but if it is shown that I am wrong and the Hydrascape crew really have given up all the shit, then of course it will be lifted. I never said it was permanent.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 18, 2008, 12:48:41 am[/size][hr]Another amendment, wow I'm on a roll.
Please read http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,305182.0.html

item.title: Hydrascape is not welcome here
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Quick warning about “Hydrascape” - it is being run by known scammers, probably with the intention of stealing any passwords they can get from you after they’ve whored everyone for their money through donations and adverts.

Talking about Hydrascape anywhere outside questions in this thread = ban.
Advertising Hydrascape = ban.

If you have run anything from them already, I strongly suggest taking measures to get rid of the ddosers/password stealers that are probably running on your pc.

Thanks and good day :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 18, 2008, 12:07:04 am[/size][hr]An amendment to the original post:

I have spoken with the owner of Hydrascape, and he is understandably pretty pissed that we’ve felt the need to do this. I realise that in my original post I was pretty aggresive, so I should probably point out that I have no proof that there is anything going on at Hydrascape other than a group of people trying to make a successful server, and it is possible that they are 100% legit. However, given the reputation of the staff, it’s equally possible that its not.

So for now I’m going to say that the above post still applies, but if it is shown that I am wrong and the Hydrascape crew really have given up all the shit, then of course it will be lifted. I never said it was permanent.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 18, 2008, 12:48:41 am[/size][hr]Another amendment, wow I’m on a roll.

Please read http://moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,305182.0.html
